page.title: 16Local History and Houses.- 2
page.content: There is a derelict cottage in the wood at Dingwood Park which used to be the gamekeeper's. We also discovered some lime kilns which were used to produce fertiliser. The presence of lime in the Dingwood Park area has made the water very hard. The water originally obtained by windpump is now pumped by electricity. Many changes have taken place in the area as a whole. The population has decreased dramatically and as the younger people have moved away there has been an influx of retired business and professional people. Many of the cottages once used by farm or estate workers are now week-end or holiday homes.
